intro: Tribolium uniolae, commonly known as the water pennywort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It typically grows in slow-moving freshwater environments such as streams and ponds. The plant has slender, branching stems that are often submerged, with small, oval leaves arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are usually borne in clusters. Tribolium uniolae plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
